customer.dwolla¶

What follows are the details of the customer.dwolla implementation.

class customer.dwolla.DwollaClient[source]¶

This is a basic client implementation for the Dwolla API

__init__()[source]¶

Initializes an instance of the DwollaClient

api_url¶

retrieves the api url for the client to use

Returns:str
client¶

The client object Returns:

customer_url¶

the endpoint for customers :returns: str

funding_source_url¶

The endpoint for funding sources

Returns:str
static instance()[source]¶

Singleton accessor for the client

Returns:customer.dwolla.DwollaClient
refresh()[source]¶

Refreshes the client token

token¶

The token for this client

Returns:str
customer.dwolla.dwolla_create_transfer(purchase)[source]¶

Creates a purchase of crypto transfer from a user to the PSP

Parameters:purchase (customer.models.Purchase) – The Purchase object to use to determine what has been sent to the PSP
Returns:the transfer object that has been created
Return type:dict
customer.dwolla.dwolla_create_user(user)[source]¶

Takes a PSPUser and creates a user for them in the Dwolla API

Parameters:user (customer.models.PSPUser) – The PSPUser to create in the Dwolla API:
Returns:success of the operation
Return type:bool
customer.dwolla.dwolla_generate_funding_source_token(user)[source]¶

Takes a user and generates a token to use. That token is used to create a funding source for this user

Parameters:user (customer.models.PSPUser) – The PSPUser to create a token for in the creation of a funding source
Returns:the token that was created
Return type:str
customer.dwolla.dwolla_get_balance(funding_source)[source]¶

Gets the balance of a users funding source. Note that this does not work in sandbox mode.

Parameters:funding_source (str) – The funding source url to get the balance of
Returns:A dictionary with balance information
Return type:dict

Gets a list of funding sources for a user

Return type:list

Gets a list of all transfers associated with a user

Sends an amount of fiat to a user based on the parameters of the Deposit object sent to it.

This method is used to simulate ACH transfers for the sandbox
